meanings.definition: A supposition or proposed explanation made on the basis of limited evidence as a starting point for further investigation.
meanings.sent1: Scientists test different hypotheses to find out more about the world.
meanings.sent2: In science class, we learned how to form hypotheses before conducting experiments.
meanings.sent3: The idea that aliens built the pyramids is an amusing hypothesis.
meanings.sent4: Her hypothesis that eating carrots improves vision was proven wrong.
meanings.sent5: The detective had many hypotheses about who committed the crime.

meanings.definition: A proposition made as a basis for reasoning, without any assumption of its truth.
meanings.sent1: The philosopher presented several hypotheses to challenge existing beliefs.
meanings.sent2: In philosophy, hypotheses are used to explore different possibilities.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing to think about wild hypotheses without any evidence.
meanings.sent4: His hypothesis that all swans are white was shattered when he saw a black swan.
meanings.sent5: The hypothesis that cats have nine lives is just a myth.
